alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued April 19 at 1:24PM EDT until April 20 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures around 24 to 32 degrees expected. The coldest temperatures are most likely in the central Shenandoah Valley and Blue Ridge Mountains. * WHERE...The Shenandoah Valley, eastern West Virginia Panhandle, Virginia Blue Ridge, portions of the central and northern Virginia Piedmont, and Washington County in Maryland. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 9 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
